abstract: Anxiety is mounting, however, about which countries — and whose companies — will benefit from the clean-energy boom, a potential topic of interest for business leaders at Davos. China has been pouring state resources into the sector.
snippet: Anxiety is mounting, however, about which countries — and whose companies — will benefit from the clean-energy boom, a potential topic of interest for business leaders at Davos. China has been pouring state resources into the sector.
lead_paragraph: For years, China was seen as a major obstacle to global efforts to combat climate change because of its refusal to reduce emissions under the Kyoto Protocol.

headline.main: Efforts to Fight Climate Change Revive Optimism
